metadata.Title: CVE-2017-18193 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
fs/f2fs/extent_cache.c in the Linux kernel before 4.13 mishandles extent trees, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (BUG) via an application with multiple threads. It was discovered that a race condition existed in the F2FS implementation in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-18193` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1022-aws - 4.4.0-1022.22
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-127-generic - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-127-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-127-lowlatency - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-127-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-127-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-127-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-127-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-127-generic - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-127-generic - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-127-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-127-lowlatency - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-127-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-127-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-127-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1

linux-image-extra-4.4.0-127-generic - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> The affected user base for this issue is likely small since f2fs is not the default filesystem and it is not widely used in Ubuntu

criterions.comment: linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1022.22').
linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
